definitions.definition: A stringed instrument (chordophone), played with a plectrum (a pick), and most commonly possessing four wire strings and chromatic frets.
A group or association mainly of tradespeople made up of merchants, craftspeople, or artisans for mutual aid, particularly in the Middle Ages.
A corporation.
A group of diverse species that share common characteristics or habits.
An organized group of players who regularly play together in a multiplayer game.
Brazilian jiu-jitsu.

A method of self-defence established in Japan emphasizing “jū” (soft or gentle) “jutsu” (art or technique). Japanese martial art that utilizes a large variety of techniques in defense against an opponent.
Brazilian jiu-jitsu, a related art, derived from judo.
Precision maneuvering.
A kick made with the kicking leg crossed behind the other leg.

A fixed or operable opening in a vehicle roof (car or truck) which allows fresh air and/or light to enter the passenger compartment. A sunroof may include a transparent or opaque panel and may be manually operated or power driven.
One who is intolerant; a bigot.
Unable or indisposed to tolerate, endure or bear.
definitions.example: I am lactose-intolerant, so I can't drink milk.

definitions.definition: Not tolerant; close-minded about new or different ideas; indisposed to tolerate contrary opinions or beliefs; impatient of dissent or opposition; denying or refusing the right of private opinion or choice in others; inclined to persecute or suppress dissent.
The science and technology of creating nanoparticles and of manufacturing machines which have sizes within the range of nanometres.
The purchase of one company by another; a merger without the formation of a new company, especially where some stakeholders in the purchased company oppose the purchase.
The acquisition of a public company whose shares are listed on a stock exchange, in contrast to the acquisition of a private company.
A time or event in which control or authority, especially over a facility is passed from one party to the next.
Financially ruined, bankrupt.
Without any money, penniless.
definitions.example: dead broke; flat broke

definitions.definition: Broken.
definitions.example: If it ain't broke, don't fix it.

definitions.definition: Demoted, deprived of a commission.
definitions.example: He was broke and rendered unfit to serve His Majesty at sea.

definitions.definition: A mediator between a buyer and seller.
A stockbroker.
A mediator in general, one who liaises between two or more parties to attempt to achieve an outcome of some kind.
An agent involved in the exchange of messages or transactions.
To act as a broker; to mediate in a sale or transaction.
To act as a broker in; to arrange or negotiate.
To harden organic matter by permeating with water and depositing dissolved minerals.
To produce rigidity akin to stone.
To immobilize with fright.
To become stone, or of a stony hardness, as organic matter by calcareous deposits.
To become stony, callous, or obdurate.
To make callous or obdurate; to stupefy; to paralyze; to transform; as by petrification.
An overly formal person, especially one who adheres to current forms; a stickler
An advocate of formalism
Of or pertaining to formalism; formalistic
To have enough courage (to do something).
definitions.example: I wouldn't dare argue with my boss.

definitions.definition: To defy or challenge (someone to do something)
definitions.example: I dare you (to) kiss that girl.

definitions.definition: To have enough courage to meet or do something, go somewhere, etc.; to face up to
definitions.example: Will you dare death to reach your goal?

definitions.definition: To terrify; to daunt.
To catch (larks) by producing terror through the use of mirrors, scarlet cloth, a hawk, etc., so that they lie still till a net is thrown over them.
To stare stupidly or vacantly; to gaze as though amazed or terrified.
To lie or crouch down in fear.
Boldness.
Adventurous, willing to take on or look for risks; overbold.
Courageous or showing bravery; doughty.
Racy; sexually provocative.
A scoring system in which points are awarded based on the number of strokes used to sink the ball, as opposed to match play.
A very pale colour that is almost white.
Of a very pale colour that is almost white.
A savory snack.
Tasty, attractive to the palate.
definitions.example: The fine restaurant presented an array of savory dishes; each was delicious.

definitions.definition: Salty and/or spicy, but not sweet.
definitions.example: The mushrooms, meat, bread, rice, peanuts and potatoes were all good savory foods.

definitions.definition: Umami, modern
definitions.example: The savory rabbit soup contrasted well with the sweet cucumber sandwiches with jam.

definitions.definition: Morally or ethically acceptable.
definitions.example: Readers are to be warned that quotations in this chapter contain some not so savory language.

definitions.definition: Any of several Mediterranean herbs, of the genus Satureja, grown as culinary flavourings.
The leaves of these plants used as a flavouring.
One thousand (103) watts.
A band or chain worn around the wrist as jewelry/jewellery or an ornament.
The strap of a wristwatch, used to secure it around the wrist.
(chiefly in the plural) A handcuff.
A piece of defensive armour for the arm.
To surround with, or as if with, a bracelet; to ring or encompass.
Of, or pertaining to the menopause
A quick, light sweeping motion.
definitions.example: With a quick whisk, she swept the cat from the pantry with her broom.

definitions.definition: A kitchen utensil, made from stiff wire loops fixed to a handle, used for whipping (or a mechanical device with the same function).
definitions.example: He used a whisk to whip up a light and airy souffle.

definitions.definition: A bunch of twigs or hair etc, used as a brush.
definitions.example: Peter dipped the whisk in lather and applied it to his face, so he could start shaving.

definitions.definition: A small handheld broom with a small (or no) handle.
definitions.example: I used a whisk to sweep the counter, then a push-broom for the floor.

definitions.definition: A plane used by coopers for evening chines.
A kind of cape, forming part of a woman's dress.
An impertinent fellow.
To move something with quick light sweeping motions.
definitions.example: Vernon whisked the sawdust from his workbench.

definitions.definition: In cooking, to whip e.g. eggs or cream.
definitions.example: The chef prepared to whisk the egg whites for the angel's food cake.

definitions.definition: To move something rapidly and with no warning.
definitions.example: The governess whisked the children from the room before they could see their presents.

definitions.definition: To move lightly and nimbly.
definitions.example: The children whisked down the road to the fair, laughing and chattering as they went.

definitions.definition: The card game whist.
The landing of an aircraft or spacecraft in an emergency, either in an inappropriate place or under dangerous circumstances
A small horse; specifically, any of several small breeds of horse under 14.2 hands at the withers.
A small serving of an alcoholic beverage, especially beer.
definitions.example: 1879, “Some Queer Interviews: Interview with a Pony of Beer”, Puck, Vol. 5–6, p. 435

definitions.definition: (New South Wales, Victoria) A serving of 140 millilitres of beer (formerly 5 fl oz); a quarter pint.
Twenty-five pounds sterling.
A translation used as a study aid; loosely, a crib, a cheat-sheet.
A ponytail hairstyle.
To lead (a horse) from another horse.
To use a crib or cheat-sheet in translating.
Crap; rubbish, nonsense.
Of little worth.
Having, or pertaining to, a tendency to fidget; restless.
Like the rose flower; pink; rosy.
Full of roses.
An organized event in which prospective romantic partners meet each other through a series of short one-to-one meetings
A Hindu or Buddhist religious or esoteric text.
Postman.
definitions.example: Did the postie come this morning?

definitions.definition: To telephone, to call on the telephone.
To connect a computer to a modem.
To increase the level (of something) by turning a dial, or (figuratively) as if by turning a dial.
definitions.example: These comments are guaranteed to dial up the animosity.

definitions.definition: A food or meal that needs little preparation or cooking, especially one sold prepackaged.
A dazed or unconscious condition.
A state of awareness, concentration, and/or focus that filters experience and information (for example, a state of meditation or possession by some being).
A state of low response to stimulus and diminished, narrow attention; particularly one induced by hypnosis.
Short for trance music.
To (cause to) be in a trance; to entrance.
To create in or via a trance.
(obsolete outside Britain) A tedious journey.
(obsolete outside Britain) To walk heavily or with some difficulty; to tramp, to trudge.
(obsolete outside Britain) To pass across or over; to traverse.
(obsolete outside Britain) To travel quickly over a long distance.
A unit of mass equal to one-thousandth of a kilogram. Symbol: g
A leguminous plant grown for its seeds, especially the chickpea.
The seeds of these plants.
Grandmother
Angry
A photograph or video shared on this service.
The number of protons in an atom. Symbol: Z
To stop suddenly and unexpectedly
Quantum mechanics
(often in combination) Having manners or (often excessive) mannerisms.
definitions.example: His upbringing had led him to act in an overly mannered way.

definitions.definition: A board used as a temporary footbridge between a ship and a dockside.
(collective) A group of geese when they are on the ground or on the water.
(by extension) Any group or gathering of related things.
To make a noise like a goose; to cackle.
A belt or strap that attaches a person to an immovable object for safety.
A life belt.
A seat belt.
A type of undergarment worn by women; a shift or slip.
A blouse; a smock frock.
A loose garment worn as protection by a painter, etc.
To provide with, or clothe in, a smock or a smock frock.
To apply smocking.
Of or pertaining to a smock; resembling a smock
Hence, of or pertaining to a woman.
A ridge of sand caused by the action of waves along a shore.
A citrus fruit originating in East Asia, Citrus ichangensis x Citrus reticulata var. austera.
To move back; to retreat; to withdraw.
To cede back; to grant or yield again to a former possessor.
definitions.example: to recede conquered territory

definitions.definition: To take back.
Pleasing to the eye; attractive.
A sport where people perform spins, jumps and other moves on skates.
An offense against the sovereign power in a state; treason.
An act of disrespect towards authority.
Someone, particularly a male acquaintance, from one’s hometown.
A close friend or fellow member of a youth gang.
A person.
To try to get a ride in a passing vehicle while standing at the side of a road, generally by either sticking out one's finger or thumb or holding a sign with one's stated destination.

To be carried along with something else, for example Genetic Hitchhiking where a gene is propagated because it occurs in conjunction with a favourable mutation, or Cultural Hitchhiking where a cultural trait spreads with a technologically advanced population.
A roundabout or indirect way of speaking; the use of more words than necessary to express an idea.
A roundabout expression.
To regard with horror or detestation; to shrink back with shuddering from; to feel excessive repugnance toward; to detest to extremity; to loathe.
definitions.example: I absolutely abhor being stuck in traffic jams

definitions.definition: To fill with horror or disgust.
To turn aside or avoid; to keep away from; to reject.
(canon law) To protest against; to reject solemnly.
To shrink back with horror, disgust, or dislike; to be contrary or averse; construed with from.
Differ entirely from.

An enclosed piece of land, usually small and arable and used for small-scale food production, and often with a dwelling next to it; in particular, such a piece of land rented to a farmer (a crofter), especially in Scotland, together with a right to use separate pastureland shared by other crofters.
To do agricultural work on one or more crofts.
To place (cloth, etc.) on the ground in the open air in order to sun and bleach it.
An underground chamber; a crypt, an undercroft.
A cave or cavern.
A carafe.
(travel) A hotel rate that includes accommodation, breakfast and dinner, but no meal at lunchtime.
A manoeuvre by which a sailing-ship gains distance to windward by luffing up into the wind.
To persist steadfastly in pursuit of an undertaking, task, journey, or goal, even if hindered by distraction, difficulty, obstacles, or discouragement.
To stay constant; to continue in a certain state; to remain.
Someone who practices or advocates utilitarianism.
Of or relating to utility
Pertaining to utilitarianism
Practical and functional, present for use, not just for show.
Incapable of being subdued, overcome, or vanquished.
A cosmetic made from coloured talc, applied to the face.
A joke or type of wordplay in which similar definitions or sounds of two words or phrases, or different definitions of the same word, are deliberately confused.
definitions.example: The pun is the lowest form of wit.

definitions.definition: To beat; strike with force; to ram; to pound, as in a mortar; reduce to powder, to pulverize.
To make or tell a pun; to make a play on words.
definitions.example: We punned about the topic until all around us groaned.

definitions.definition: A Korean unit of length equivalent to about 0.3 cm.
To intercept or catch (a ball) and play it.
(and other batting sports) To be the team catching and throwing the ball, as opposed to hitting it.
definitions.example: The blue team are fielding first, while the reds are batting.

definitions.definition: To place (a team, its players, etc.) in a game.
definitions.example: The away team fielded two new players and the second-choice goalkeeper.

definitions.definition: To answer; to address.
definitions.example: She will field questions immediately after her presentation.

definitions.definition: To defeat.
definitions.example: They fielded a fearsome army.

definitions.definition: To execute research (in the field).
definitions.example: He fielded the marketing survey about the upcoming product.

definitions.definition: To deploy in the field.
definitions.example: to field a new land-mine detector

definitions.definition: The act of one who fields.
definitions.example: the fielding of questions from an audience

definitions.definition: The role of a fielder.
To treat someone or something badly or unkindly; to abuse or mistreat
A rack attached to a car or other vehicle, used to hold luggage or similar items.
To bother or trouble.
To harass, to harry, often with the intent to cause injury.
To chafe, to rub or subject to friction; to create a sore on the skin.
To exasperate.
To cause pitting on a surface being cut from the friction between the two surfaces exceeding the bond of the material at a point.
definitions.example: Improper cooling and a dull milling blade on titanium can gall the surface.

definitions.definition: To scoff; to jeer.
To impregnate with a decoction of gallnuts in dyeing.
Wear caused by adhesion between sliding surfaces.
Vexing, humiliating
Any ship built or armed for naval combat.

A percussion instrument consisting of a small, usually wooden, hoop closed on one side with a drum frame and featuring jingling metal disks on the tread; it is most often held in the hand and shaken rhythmically; by extension, any frame drum.
A tambourine dove.
A kind of Provençal dance.
The music for this dance.
In an ambitious manner.
A situation where a number of large spending or taxation bills begin or end simultaneously.
An uptight person.
Excessively concerned with rules and order, always serious.
definitions.example: Don't be so uptight! You won't go to jail for crossing the street against the light.

definitions.definition: Emotionally repressed; nervous and tense.
Sexually repressed.
definitions.example: He came from a very uptight religious background, but you wouldn't know that now!

definitions.definition: Unfriendly and rude.
Cruel or savage.
definitions.example: The truculent soldiers gave us a steely-eyed stare.

definitions.definition: Deadly or destructive.
Defiant or uncompromising.
Eager or quick to argue, fight or start a conflict.
A list of recorded songs scheduled to be played on a radio station.
A list of tracks to be played in a particular sequence, as from an audio CD.
A list of songs, prepared for a band or musical artist, to be performed during a concert; a setlist.
To include (a track) on a playlist.
definitions.example: She achieved success when her first single was playlisted on national radio.

definitions.definition: A leader of a clan or tribe.
(by extension) A leader of a group.
definitions.example: The robber chieftain divided up the spoils.

definitions.definition: A goal that results from a player putting the ball or puck into the goal of his or her own team; the resulting goal being scored for the opposition.
A blunder that damages one’s own prospects.
A telephone operator.
The killing of one's brother (or sister).
A person who commits this crime.
(by extension) The intentional or unintentional killing of a comrade in arms.
(by extension) The undesirable situation where the separate missiles from a MIRV interfere with each other as they explode.
A moist sausage of soft, even texture and flavor, often made from mechanically recovered meat or meat slurry.
To interact socially for the purpose of getting connections or personal advancement.
definitions.example: Many people find it worthwhile to network for jobs and information.

definitions.definition: To connect two or more computers or other computerized devices.
definitions.example: If we network his machine to the server, he will be able to see all the files.

definitions.definition: To interconnect a group or system.
To broadcast across an entire network of stations and affiliates at the same time.
The use of computer networks.
The process of meeting new people in a business or social context.
A vertical line in musical notation used to separate two bars or measures.
A line that crosses other lines.
A line running across an insect.
A small headline running across one or more columns, but not extending to the full width of the page.
The act of swimming or bathing, especially in the sea, a lake, or a river; a swimming bath.
definitions.example: I'm going to have a midnight bathe tonight.

definitions.definition: To clean oneself by immersion in water or using water; to take a bath, have a bath.
To immerse oneself, or part of the body, in water for pleasure or refreshment; to swim.
To clean a person by immersion in water or using water; to give someone a bath.
definitions.example: We bathe our baby before going to bed; other parents do it in the morning if they have time.

definitions.definition: To apply water or other liquid to; to suffuse or cover with liquid.
definitions.example: She bathed her eyes with liquid to remove the stinging chemical.

definitions.definition: (transitive and intransitive) To cover or surround.
definitions.example: A dense fog bathed the city streets.

definitions.definition: To sunbathe.
definitions.example: The women bathed in the sun.

definitions.definition: A substance that causes sepsis or putrefaction.
A septic tank; a system for the disposal of sewage into a septic tank, a septic system.
Of or pertaining to sepsis.
Causing sepsis or putrefaction.
Of or pertaining to sewage or the disposal of sewage.
A mathematical object (function, curve, surface, etc.) of degree seven.
Of the seventh degree or order.
An American, a Yank.
To fall one drop at a time.
definitions.example: Listening to the tap next door drip all night drove me mad!

definitions.definition: To leak slowly.
definitions.example: Does the sink drip, or have I just spilt water over the floor?

definitions.definition: To let fall in drops.
definitions.example: After putting oil on the side of the salad, the chef should drip a little vinegar in the oil.

definitions.definition: (usually with with) To have a superabundance of valuable things.
definitions.example: The Old Hall simply drips with masterpieces of the Flemish painters.

definitions.definition: (of the weather) To rain lightly.
definitions.example: The weather isn't so bad. I mean, it's dripping, but you're not going to get so wet.

definitions.definition: To be wet, to be soaked.
To whine or complain consistently; to grumble.
A drop of a liquid.
definitions.example: I put a drip of vanilla extract in my hot cocoa.

definitions.definition: A falling or letting fall in drops; act of dripping.
An apparatus that slowly releases a liquid, especially one that intravenously releases drugs into a patient's bloodstream.
definitions.example: He's not doing so well. The doctors have put him on a drip.

definitions.definition: A limp, ineffectual, or uninteresting person.
definitions.example: He couldn't even summon up the courage to ask her name... what a drip!

definitions.definition: That part of a cornice, sill course, or other horizontal member, which projects beyond the rest, and has a section designed to throw off rainwater.
A dividend reinvestment program; a type of financial investing.
A small industrial vehicle with a power-operated fork-like pronged platform that can be raised and lowered for insertion under a load, often on pallets, to be lifted and moved
The state of being objective, just, unbiased and not influenced by emotions or personal prejudices.
The world as it really is; reality.
An unforeseen, inopportune, or embarrassing event; a hitch
An ill-timed pass.
Any of a group of large American snakes, of the genus Boa, subfamily Boinae, or family Boidae, including the boa constrictor, the emperor boa of Mexico, and the chevalier boa of Peru.
(plural "boas") A type of scarf typically made from feathers.
An act of throwing, often violently.
An act of moving the limbs or body with violent movements, especially in a dance.
definitions.example: the fling of a horse

definitions.definition: An act or period of unrestrained indulgence.
A short casual sexual relationship.
definitions.example: I had a fling with a girl I met on holiday.

definitions.definition: An attempt, a try (as in "give it a fling").
A severe or contemptuous remark; an expression of sarcastic scorn; a gibe or taunt.
A lively Scottish country dance.
definitions.example: the Highland fling

definitions.definition: A trifling matter; an object of contempt.
To move (oneself) abruptly or violently; to rush or dash.
To throw with violence or quick movement; to hurl.
To throw; to wince; to flounce.
To utter abusive language; to sneer.
definitions.example: The scold began to flout and fling.

definitions.definition: Anything that flashes, especially a device that switches a light on and off.
An indicator or turn signal.
A person who exposes their genitals or female nipples.
(operations) The stock of an item on hand at a particular location or business.
definitions.example: Due to an undersized inventory at the Boston outlet, customers had to travel to Providence to find the item.

definitions.definition: (operations) A detailed list of all of the items on hand.
definitions.example: The inventory included several items that one wouldn't normally think to find at a cheese shop.

definitions.definition: (operations) The process of producing or updating such a list.
definitions.example: This month's inventory took nearly three days.

definitions.definition: A space containing the items available to a character for immediate use.
definitions.example: You can't get through the underground tunnel if there are more than three items in your inventory.

definitions.definition: (operations) To take stock of the resources or items on hand; to produce an inventory.
definitions.example: The main job of the night shift was to inventory the store, and restock when necessary.

definitions.definition: Any of numerous marine plants and algae, such as a kelp.
To contract or get (an illness); to show symptoms of.
definitions.example: With a scratchy throat and a cough, it feels like I'm coming down with a cold.

definitions.definition: To lay down (money) in payment; to pay.
Effort; the act of one who strives.
